content.rendered:
About the Rotary Timor-Leste project expo

“The Rotary Timor-Leste Project Expo is an opportunity for Rotary Clubs, Rotary Districts, and other NGOs active in Timor-Leste, to display their projects, seek partners and funding opportunities, and network with people with an interest in the community development of Timor-Leste. Hosted by Rotary District 9550, the Rotary Club of Dili, and the Rotary Club of Dili Lafaek, and to be held at the Timor Plaza Hotel in Dili on the 14th – 16th August 2020
A visit to Timor-Leste will change your life. It is a beautiful country inhabited by the friendliest of people, proud of their independence, and determined to make improvements to their communities” (Rotary Timor-Leste Project Expo Facebook page)

Study Tours

Rotary has been an effective and persistent contributor to the development of Timor-Leste since it voted to become a new nation in 1999. The study tours are designed to provide an opportunity to see some of the important work that has been done, meet the people who have been involved in the projects and understand the impacts of this important work.

5 day pre expo tour: Learn about the important historical sites in Dili, visit Rotary projects and travel to Balibo (Download the itinerary) * minimum of 8 people required to run this tour

3 day post expo tour: Tour the sites of Dili, visit Rotary projects, tour to the west of Dili and into the mountains to visit Maubisse (Download the itinerary) * minimum of 8 people required to run this tour

If you have a question, want to book one of these tours or want us to design a customised tour for you contact us

Other tour options

For those with less time here are a few options for half day and full day tours. 

1/2 day Dili orientation

North West panorama day tour

Maubisse mountain day tour

About us and our tours

Timor Adventures has been running tours in Timor-Leste for 10 years. We established Timor Adventures to improve economic development. Tourism seemed like a good choice because tourism can operate successfully in any district.

Our local guides are all experienced and can explain the history and culture of Timor-Leste. They speak English as several other languages. 

Looking forward to seeing you at the Rotary Projects Expo

Dave, Shirley, Julio & Jonias
